text: Bannon, we have a jam-packed show for you tonight between election integrity victories and, of course, revelations regarding VP candidate Tim Walz.

text: I want to welcome my first guest, Catherine Engelbrecht of True the Vote.

text: Catherine, you guys have been working tirelessly over the election.

text: Give us the rundown about what went on yesterday during the election board meeting.
speaker: SPEAKER_08

text: Oh, I think yesterday was just...
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: an amazing day that all Georgians and all Americans should be really, really proud of.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: And I think the thing that is most notable is that yesterday you saw feedback in the audience, people coming to the lectern to speak and present to that state election board that were representing both Republican and Democrat.

text: And they were presenting to a state election board that is also bipartisan.

text: support and veracity of documentation to stand by those results.

text: And in fact, one of the people who presented made a very distinct point of saying,

text: And that's what they were there standing in unison about.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: So, look, I'm thrilled.

text: He's done a fair bit of work there and has been in many a battle.

text: But at the end of the day, it's the citizens of Georgia who are the victors.

text: And yesterday was an enormous triumph.

speaker: SPEAKER_08

text: Well, I mean, I think that, you know, I love I love that with it.

text: And I hope that it I hope that it resonates.

text: And I hope other states will consider doing likewise.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: So what you're going to see now moving forward in Georgia is that you will have access to ballot images.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: You will have the ability to have poll watchers observing at the tabulation centers.

speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: the data that's coming into them in order that they may stand solidly around their certifications.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: And I just think these are the kind of initiatives that bolster transparency and integrity and confidence in both voters and election workers.

text: So it's it's a it's a new day in Georgia.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: And hopefully it is the end to what we saw in 2020 when there was no chain of custody to be found.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: In our case, for the projects that we were doing, you couldn't get all the video that you needed from the drop boxes.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: Let's just hope we have said goodbye to those days and are now on offense for election integrity.
speaker: SPEAKER_06

text: And it's I think it's a great thing.

text: In addition to the poll watchers and tabulation centers, they also passed a rule regarding reasonable inquiry into election results.

text: Talk about what that means for the future of elections.

text: Well, you know, as we saw across the country in 2020, reasonable inquiries were shut down and there really wasn't a path for them.
